intro: Keraselma segetale, commonly known as the field keravel, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Keraselma segetale is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
